alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 26 at 12:54PM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...The chance for snow showers is expected to arrive Sunday evening with steadier snowfall after midnight. Total snow accumulations 5 to 10 inches for elevations above 3000 ft locally over 1 foot above 4000 ft through Tuesday. A wintry mix down to 2000 feet is possible with a coating to 3 inches of snow. Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph Monday morning will lead to blowing snow and reduced visibilities. * WHERE...Above 3000 ft in the North Bay Mountains. * WHEN...10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Slick, snow-covered roads and hiking trails. Hikers, campers, and outdoor enthusiasts may encounter dangerous winter- like conditions above the snow level. Heavier snow showers could produce limited visibilities. Downed trees and power outages possible.
